required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transition of Single Surgeon Bariatric Service to an Interdisciplinary Multiple Surgeon Model
clinical_study.official_title: Transition of Single Surgeon Bariatric Service to an Interdisciplinary Multiple Surgeon Model

collaborator.agency: Central Adelaide Local Health Network Incorporated

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study will analyse the transition of an Australian hospital which significantly increased volume of bariatric operations after introduction of a clinical pathway, and to assess the outcomes. Barriers to introduction of the multidisciplinary pathway and the means to overcome these will also be analysed and discussed. The analysis will also determine if there are any other areas of bariatric surgery which can be further investigated to optimise current practice.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The number of nights the participant stay in hospital from the day of procedure to the day of hospital discharge. This time period occurs immediately after the procedure. This data will be retrospectively reviewed on an average of 5 years.
primary_outcome.description: This will be measured in number of nights the participant stayed in hospital after the procedure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The start time of the operation to the end time of the procedure. This data will be retrospectively reviewed on an average of 5 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of operative time measured in minutes
Complications which occurred in the post operative period

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of operations performed in time period
secondary_outcome.description: The number of operations which occurred in each group
The number of the different types of bariatric operations which occurred in each group

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants converted from Gastric Sleeve to Gastric Bypass
Number of patients on surgical waitlist
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients on the surgical waitlist for each time period

arm_group.description: Participants who underwent bariatric surgery between 2008 and 2012 (inclusive).
Participants who underwent bariatric surgery between 2013 and 2016 (inclusive).
Participants who underwent bariatric surgery between 2017 and 2018 (inclusive).

intervention.intervention_name: Bariatric surgery- multiple surgeon + multidisciplinary team approach
Bariatric surgery: formalized streamlined multiple surgeon + multidisciplinary team approach

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent bariatric surgery at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital (South Australia) between the years of 2008 and 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have had bariatric surgery at The Queen Elizabeth Hospital between 2008-2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- nil

overall_official.last_name: Markus Trochsler, MD, FMH, MMIS, FRACS
